title: Amos Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Amos with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 9 chapters.

questions.question: Who was Amos before he became a prophet?
options: A shepherd and gatherer of sycomore fruit
questions.correctAnswer: A shepherd and gatherer of sycomore fruit
questions.explanation: Amos described himself as a herdsman and gatherer of sycomore fruit before God called him to prophesy.

questions.question: In Amos 1, how many transgressions does the LORD say will not be overlooked before punishing Damascus?
questions.explanation: The LORD says 'for three transgressions... and for four' He will not turn away punishment, a common phrase indicating completeness.

questions.question: According to Amos 3:2, why will God punish Israel?
options: Because they are the only nation He has known
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are the only nation He has known
questions.explanation: God says He knows only Israel among all families of the earth, therefore He will punish them for their iniquities.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Can two walk together, except they be ________?'
questions.explanation: The verse uses the metaphor of walking together only if both agree.

questions.question: What will happen to the altars of Bethel, according to Amos 3:14?
options: The horns of the altar shall be cut off and fall to the ground
They will be moved to Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The horns of the altar shall be cut off and fall to the ground
questions.explanation: God promises to visit the transgressions of Israel and cut off the horns of the altar at Bethel.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 5 commands the people to seek Bethel for salvation.
questions.explanation: The LORD commands them not to seek Bethel because it will come to nought.

questions.question: Who does Amos say God strengthens against the strong in Amos 5:9?
questions.explanation: God strengthens the spoiled against the strong so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.

questions.question: What does Amos say he hates and will not smell in Amos 5:21?
options: Their feast days and solemn assemblies
questions.correctAnswer: Their feast days and solemn assemblies
questions.explanation: Amos declares he hates their feast days and will not accept their solemn assemblies.

questions.question: According to Amos 5:24, what should 'run down as waters' and 'as a mighty stream'?
questions.explanation: The famous verse calls for judgment and righteousness to flow like abundant water.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 6 criticizes those who are at ease in Zion and trust in Mount Samaria.
questions.explanation: Amos condemns those who are complacent and secure in Zion and Samaria while injustice prevails.

questions.question: What is the consequence for those who lie upon beds of ivory and eat lambs from the flock, according to Amos 6?
options: They will be taken into captivity
questions.correctAnswer: They will be taken into captivity
questions.explanation: Amos warns that their luxury will end and they will be carried away captive.

questions.question: In Amos 7, what did the Lord GOD show Amos first?
questions.explanation: The first vision was of grasshoppers consuming the latter growth.

questions.question: True or False: God repented and did not bring disaster after Amos' prayer in the first two visions in chapter 7.
questions.explanation: God relented after Amos interceded for Jacob in the first two visions.

questions.question: What object did God set in the midst of Israel in Amos 7:8 as a symbol of judgment?
questions.explanation: The plumbline represents God's standard of righteousness and judgment.

questions.question: Who was the priest of Bethel that opposed Amos in chapter 7?
questions.explanation: Amaziah was the priest who told Amos to flee to Judah and stop prophesying at Bethel.

questions.question: True or False: Amaziah welcomed Amosâ€™ prophecy at Bethel.
questions.explanation: Amaziah opposed Amos and accused him of conspiracy against the king.

questions.question: What was Amos told to do by the LORD before he became a prophet?
questions.explanation: God told Amos to leave his flock and prophesy to His people Israel.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Therefore thus saith the LORD; Thy wife shall be an _______ in the city...'?
questions.explanation: Amos prophesies that Amaziah's wife will be a harlot in the city as part of judgment.

questions.question: What will happen to the high places of Isaac, according to Amos 7:9?
questions.explanation: God declares that the high places of Isaac and sanctuaries of Israel will be laid waste.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 8 contains a vision of a basket of summer fruit symbolizing end times.
questions.explanation: Amos saw a basket of ripe summer fruit symbolizing the end of Israel's judgment.

questions.question: What will happen when the sun goes down at noon, according to Amos 8:9?
questions.explanation: Amos prophesies a darkening of the sun at noon as a sign of judgment.

questions.question: Who is described as 'the Lord GOD of hosts' who touches the land and it melts in Amos 9:5?
questions.explanation: Amos portrays God as sovereign over the earth and all creation.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 9:4 states that those who flee will escape God's judgment.
questions.explanation: God says even those who flee will be cut down and not delivered.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they ______ the just...'?
questions.explanation: The verse condemns the oppression and injustice toward the just.

questions.question: According to Amos 1:13-14, what brutal act did the children of Ammon commit?
options: They ripped up women with child of Gilead
They burned the cities of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They ripped up women with child of Gilead
questions.explanation: This act was cited as a reason for God's judgment.

questions.question: What will happen to the king of Ammon, according to Amos 1?
options: He will make peace with Israel
He will be killed in battle
questions.explanation: God declares the king and princes of Ammon will be taken captive.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 4:13 states that God made the Pleiades and Orion and changes darkness into morning.
questions.explanation: This verse highlights God's power over creation.

questions.question: In Amos 3:7, what does the LORD do before He acts?
options: He reveals His secret to His servants the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: He reveals His secret to His servants the prophets
questions.explanation: God reveals His plans through the prophets before acting.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the 'day of the LORD' as described in Amos 5:18?
options: A day of light and joy
A day of darkness and not light
questions.correctAnswer: A day of darkness and not light
questions.explanation: Amos warns that the day of the LORD will be darkness for those who desire it wrongly.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 6:4-6 criticizes those who drink wine in bowls and anoint themselves with the best oils.
questions.explanation: The passage condemns luxury and complacency among the wealthy.

questions.question: What imagery is used in Amos 4:1 to describe the women of Samaria?
questions.explanation: They are called 'cows of Bashan' who oppress the poor.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Shall not the day of the LORD be ________, and not light?'
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts darkness with light on the day of the LORD.

questions.question: According to Amos 9:11, what will God do for the fallen tabernacle of David?
options: Raise it up and repair it
questions.correctAnswer: Raise it up and repair it
questions.explanation: God promises restoration of David's fallen tabernacle.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 2:6 condemns Israel for selling the righteous for silver and the poor for a pair of shoes.
questions.explanation: This verse highlights social injustice and corruption.

questions.question: What does Amos say about the sanctuary at Bethel in chapter 3?
options: It will be a place of great blessing
Its horns will be cut off and fall
questions.correctAnswer: Its horns will be cut off and fall
questions.explanation: Amos prophesies judgment against the altar at Bethel.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 8:11 prophesies a famine for hearing the words of the LORD.
questions.explanation: Amos foretells a time when people will hunger to hear God's word but there will be none.

questions.question: Who are the 'children of Israel' addressed throughout the book of Amos?
questions.explanation: The children of Israel refers to the descendants of Jacob, also called Israel.

questions.question: What symbolic action does God command in Amos 9:1?
options: Smite the lintel of the door
questions.correctAnswer: Smite the lintel of the door
questions.explanation: God says to smite the door's lintel so the posts shake, symbolizing judgment.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 5:26 accuses Israel of carrying the tabernacle of their gods Moloch and Chiun.
questions.explanation: Israel is condemned for idolatry involving Moloch and Chiun.

questions.question: According to Amos 9:7, God compares Israel to which people?
questions.explanation: God rhetorically asks if Israel is not like the children of the Ethiopians to Him.

questions.question: What is the ultimate fate of Israel as prophesied in Amos 7:11?
options: They will be led away captive out of their own land
They will build a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: They will be led away captive out of their own land
questions.explanation: Amos foretells exile as judgment for Israel's sins.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Amos 5:4: 'For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel, ______ ye me, and ye shall live:'
questions.explanation: God invites Israel to seek Him that they may live.

questions.question: True or False: Amos 6:8 says that God will set fire in the palaces of Samaria.
questions.explanation: God declares He will set fire in Samaria's palaces and consume them.

questions.question: What does Amos say about justice and righteousness in Amos 5:7?
options: They have been abandoned and turned to wormwood
They are the foundation of the land
questions.correctAnswer: They have been abandoned and turned to wormwood
questions.explanation: Amos accuses the people of turning justice into bitterness and forsaking righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: In Amos 8, the prophet foretells the destruction of the temple in Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Amos focuses on Israel's judgment and exile, not specifically the Jerusalem temple destruction.
